newsitem.title: GHANA: Ghana bourse ends Christmas week slightly lower.
newsitem.headline: Ghana bourse ends Christmas week slightly lower.

text.p: The Ghana Stock Exchange ended Christmas week slightly lower on Friday, with dealers saying that most players were still enjoying the festive season.
The GSE All-Share-Index fell 0.03 points to close at 361.95 points.
Offers totalled 959,530 shares to 127,920, with 25,620 shares changing hands.
One market operator said that the volume was up on previous years. "Normally at such times, we sell just about 5,000 or thereabouts," he said.

The bourse, closed on Christmas Day, recorded one of its more active sessions of the year on Monday. Offers totalled 2,492,220 shares against bids of 1,488,720 shares with 1,314,020 changing hands. The index fell 0.82 points to 361.98 on Monday.
The market registered two prices changes on Friday -- paper products company SPPC (-7 cedis to 105 cedis) and Social Security Bank (+1 to 1,057).
